info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 4:03AM MST until January 13 at 7:00AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 12 inches with locally higher amounts possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Central Yampa River Basin. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 AM MST this morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from this evening through Monday evening. There may be a bit of a lull late this morning into early afternoon before the next round of heavy snow arrives. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, especially in open areas. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
